name: Mount Tallac Trail
description: Challenging climb to the summit of Mount Tallac at 9,735 feet with stunning panoramic views of Emerald Bay, Cascade Lake, Fallen Leaf Lake, and the entire South Shore. One of Lake Tahoe's most iconic hikes.

name: Eagle Lake Trail
description: Moderate hike through Desolation Wilderness leading to the picturesque Eagle Lake. Trail offers beautiful alpine scenery and is accessible from Emerald Bay.

name: Cascade Falls Trail
description: Popular short hike to a spectacular 200-foot waterfall with views of Cascade Lake and Lake Tahoe. Trail starts from Bayview Campground near Emerald Bay.

name: Rubicon Trail
description: Scenic shoreline trail along Lake Tahoe's southwest corner, contours between D.L. Bliss and Emerald Bay State Parks with continuous panoramic lake views.

name: Hidden Falls Trail
description: Beautiful hike through Sierra Foothills leading to hidden waterfalls. Network of trails up to 11 miles with mix of easy and moderate terrain. Dog-friendly on leash.

name: American River Parkway Trail
description: World-renowned 32-mile paved multi-use trail from Discovery Park in Sacramento to Beal's Point in Folsom. Follows the American River with mile markers, water fountains and restrooms.

name: Cosumnes River Preserve Trail
description: Easy loop trail through wetlands, riparian forest, and grasslands. Home to over 250 species of birds. Includes paved boardwalk to observation platform.

name: Bassi Falls Trail
description: Moderate hike in El Dorado National Forest to a stunning 109-foot waterfall. Best visited in spring and early summer when water flow is strongest.

name: Stevens Trail
description: Popular 8-mile round trip trail descending through forests along the American River. Features canyon views, wildflowers in spring, and river access for swimming.

name: Lake Natoma Loop Trail
description: Scenic 11.5-mile loop around Lake Natoma providing serene water views. Mostly flat, paved trail perfect for hiking, biking, and running.

name: Granite Lake and Maggie's Peaks
description: Most popular and challenging trail in South Lake Tahoe. Steep climb to peaks at around 8,500 feet elevation with spectacular alpine views.

name: Tahoe Meadows Interpretive Loop
description: Gentle family-friendly loop through beautiful subalpine meadows. Wildflower displays in summer, educational interpretive signs along the trail.

name: Fallen Leaf Lake Trail
description: Easy 2-mile hike along the scenic shores of Fallen Leaf Lake. Flat, well-maintained trail with serene lake views through pine forest.

name: Auburn State Recreation Area - Confluence Trail
description: Popular trail in Auburn SRA leading to the confluence of the North and Middle Forks of the American River. Moderate difficulty with river views.

name: Cronan Ranch Loop
description: Scenic loop trail through oak woodlands and along the South Fork American River. Part of Cronan Ranch Regional Trails Park with historic ranch views.
